alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 9:02AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT CENTRAL MONROE COUNTY... At 901 AM EST, a snow squall was located over Tannersville, or near Mount Pocono, moving southeast at 20 mph. Wind gusts up to 35 mph along with visibilities less than 1 mile are possible with this squall. Locations impacted include... Mount Pocono, East Stroudsburg, Delaware Water Gap, Stormville, Reeders, Henryville, Brodheadsville, Werry Lake, Saylorsburg, Analomink, McMichael, Tannersville, Alpine Mountain, Scotrun, Long Pond, Echo Lake, Paradise Valley, Stroudsburg, Cresco and Arlington Heights. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 295 and 314. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 3. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this dangerous snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
